summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, dated August 8, 2019, which designates his estate executors and directs that his entire estate be transferred to The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2019 Trust. It establishes Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn as primary executors, with Kathryn H. Ruemmler as successor.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The individual creating the will, declaring himself a resident of St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands, and directing the distribution of his estate to a trust.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Appointed as one of the primary executors of Epstein's will, responsible for administering the estate.

persons.name: Richard D. Kahn
persons.context: Appointed as one of the primary executors of Epstein's will, alongside Darren K. Indyke.

persons.name: Kathryn H. Ruemmler
persons.context: Named as the successor executor in the event that either primary executor fails to qualify or serve.

connections.description: Epstein appointed Indyke as an executor of his will, indicating a formal legal and fiduciary relationship.
Epstein appointed Kahn as an executor of his will, indicating a formal legal and fiduciary relationship.
Epstein named Ruemmler as the successor executor of his will, establishing a contingent legal relationship.
Both were appointed as co-executors of Epstein's will, indicating a professional partnership in administering the estate.

events.title: Execution of Epstein's Will
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein signed his last will and testament, designating executors and directing his estate to a trust.

events.title: Creation of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2019 Trust
events.description: The trust agreement for The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2019 Trust was established, which is the beneficiary of Epstein's estate per his will.

locations: St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's will was executed on August 8, 2019, just two days before his death.
The entire estate is directed to be transferred to 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2019 Trust', a trust created on January 18, 2019.
Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn are named as primary executors, each to receive $250,000 upon completion of probate.
Kathryn H. Ruemmler, a former White House counsel, is named as the successor executor.
Epstein declared himself a resident and domiciliary of St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands, which may have implications for estate taxation and probate jurisdiction.
